intro: Commelina ceciliae, commonly known as the Cecilia spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies.
